name: Health Plan P094

claim_rejection_clauses.reason: Waiting period not completed for pre-existing conditions

detailed_terms: Aditya Birla's Health insurance plan provides tailored protection with a coverage of ₹1,500,000 at an annual premium of ₹17,770. This plan offers extensive coverage including hospitalization expenses, pre- and post-hospitalization benefits, and access to cashless treatments across a wide hospital network. Optional riders such as Cancer Protection Rider, Accidental Death Benefit enhance protection based on individual and family needs. Policy exclusions include Pre-existing disease for 2 years, War or terrorism injuries, Participation in hazardous sports, Mental illness treatments. Pre-existing diseases are covered after a waiting period of 1 month. Policyholders are eligible for annual health checkups, tax benefits under Section 80D, and lifelong renewability. Claims may be rejected for issues like misrepresentation, claims within the waiting period, or treatment in non-network hospitals without approval.

underwriting_profile.notes: Risk assessment includes lifestyle and medical history. Lab reports required for high-risk applicants.

This plan offers extensive coverage including hospitalization expenses, pre- and post-hospitalization benefits, and access to cashless treatments across a wide hospital network. Optional riders such as Accidental Death Benefit, Critical Illness Cover, Cancer Protection Rider enhance protection based on individual and family needs. Policy exclusions include Participation in hazardous sports, Self-inflicted injuries, Dental treatment unless due to accident, War or terrorism injuries. Pre-existing diseases are covered after a waiting period of 6 months. Policyholders are eligible for annual health checkups, tax benefits under Section 80D, and lifelong renewability. Claims may be rejected for issues like misrepresentation, claims within the waiting period, or treatment in non-network hospitals without approval.

underwriting_profile.notes: Risk assessment includes lifestyle and medical history. Lab reports required for high-risk applicants.
